subject: Education
title: The Testing Effect: Quizzes Beat Re-Reading
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Testing Effect: Quizzes Beat Re-Reading usable.

hook.text: Students who took practice quizzes scored 50% higher than those who re-studied.

buildup.text: Re-reading feels productive but only creates an illusion of knowing.

discovery.text: Retrieving a memory strengthens it far more than passively reviewing it.

twist.text: The harder the retrieval, the stronger the memory becomes afterward.

climax.text: Low-stakes quizzes are one of the most evidence-backed study strategies.

quiz.question: Why are practice quizzes more effective than re-reading?
options: Retrieving memories strengthens them more than reviewing
Quizzes are more fun so students pay more attention
Re-reading is too fast to be useful
